title: Rate Law Expression for NO and Cl2 reaction

content.description: <math alttext="2 N O gas plus C l 2 gas react to produce 2 N O C l gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NOCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Experiment <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> Initial Rate of <math alttext="N O C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NOCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Formation <math alttext="molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> 1 0.0250 0.0510 <math alttext="4.55 times 10 to the negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.55</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> 2 0.0250 0.1020 <math alttext="9.10 times 10 to the negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9.10</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> 3 0.0500 0.0510 <math alttext="1.82 times 10 to the negative 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.82</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> The initial rates of the reaction represented by the equation shown above were measured for different initial concentrations of <math alttext="N O gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the data given in the table above, which of the following is the rate law expression for the reaction, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, because the initial rate quadrupled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was doubled but remained constant when <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> was doubled.

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O, times the molar concentration of C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>[NO][Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the initial rate doubled when either <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> was doubled.

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O, times the molar concentration of C l 2, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi><mtext>[NO][Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the initial rate doubled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was doubled and quadrupled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> was doubled.

<math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O squared, times the molar concentration of C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the initial rate quadrupled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was doubled and doubled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> was doubled.

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of N O squared, times the molar concentration of C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the initial rate quadrupled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[NO]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was doubled and doubled when <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> was doubled.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
